Description of incident: "Federal investigators say two women orchestrated an identity theft ring that targeted at least 20 people. But it's how suspects Jamila Williams-Stevenson and Loretta Coburn are said to have gotten some of their victim's personal information that is most shocking.Authorities said several of the alleged victims had been patients at Yale-New Haven Hospital where Williams-Stevenson was working as a companion or sitter.""According to a court affidavit, once the two changed their alleged victims addresses, they took control of their mail, then took control of their finances."More Information: http://www.nbcconnecticut.com/troubleshooters/Hospital-Patients-Caught-i...
